content: australia where the sun seems to shine the majority of the year i embraced the crackling of wood on an open fire while sipping a warm coffee to create this pattern 2 before you begin before you start it is important to note the following details the headband is designed as a snug fit for all ages - from newborn to adults it can be customised to use any yarn and colour combination from wool to a cotton blend for summer if you are using a lighter or heavier weight yarn use the recommended hook size for the first row of the pattern and increase the hook by 0 5mm during the camel and star stitch row you can change back to the smaller hook for the last row to tighten the top of the headband depending on your gauge and yarn the best yarn for this headband is a wool blend as it holds the shape but allows a nice stretch as well i have tested this with 100% acrylic yarn fiddlesticks superb 8 for those with an allergy to the woolen fiber if using this type of yarn do not increase the hook size during the pattern keep using the recommended hook for your yarn type the pattern uses a repetition of row 3-5 and as such the headband can be customised to be either longer or shorter for headband or earwarmer the pattern is designed for earwarmers once you are familiar with the pattern the possibilities are endless the star stitch is worked in multiples of 2 + 1 your foundation row the first row in the pattern will always be an odd number when adjusting the pattern ensure you decrease by 2 each time meaning you are removing one star from the body of the pattern i hope you enjoy making this headband as much as i enjoyed designing it please post your designs on instagram or facebook as i would love to see them for more pattern ideas please visit by website https
